  • Method Details

    • incrementNumber1

      public int incrementNumber1(int number)
      Increments the given integer by 1 and returns the result.
      Parameters:
      number - the integer to be incremented
      Returns:
      the incremented value of the input integer

    • incrementNumber2

      public int incrementNumber2()
      Increments the field "number" by 1 and returns the updated value.
      Returns:
      the incremented value of the field "number".

    • incrementArray1

      public int[] incrementArray1(int[] array)
      This method attempts to increment each element of the input array by one using a foreach loop. However, the increment operation does not affect the original array due to how Java handles primitive types inside a foreach loop.
      Parameters:
      array - an array of integers which should be incremented element-wise
      Returns:
      the original array without any modification

    • incrementArray2

      public int[] incrementArray2(int[] array)
      Increments each element of the given array by 1.
      Parameters:
      array - the array of integers to be incremented
      Returns:
      the modified array with each element incremented by 1

    • incrementArray3

      public int[] incrementArray3()
      Attempts to increment each element of the array field by 1 using a foreach loop. However, the foreach loop operates on a copy of each array element and does not modify the original array.
      Returns:
      the original array without any modification

    • incrementArray4

      public int[] incrementArray4()
      Increments each element of the array field "array" by 1.
      Returns:
      the modified array with each element incremented by 1.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The main method demonstrates the behavior of various methods in the CallByValue class.
      Parameters:
      args - command-line arguments passed to the program
